Doing this can confirm that steering and driving motors both work correctly on their own. It would also let you confirm that all \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eCAN\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Controller Area Network\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e IDs are what you expect them to be. If possible you should also label your physical motor controllers with their can ids to help with troubleshooting.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-02-27T22:10:12.843Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":36,"readers_count":35,"score":17.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":456417,"topic_slug":"drive-wheel-jitters","display_username":"Brandon McDonald","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57348,"username":"Nyar","name":"3865","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nyar/{size}/185735_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FAMNM President"},"post_url":"/t/drive-wheel-jitters/456417/11","custom_user_title":"FAMNM President","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3319227,"name":"3865","username":"Nyar","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nyar/{size}/185735_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-27T22:11:51.019Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eCan id’s are set properly, trust me i checked personally and went through and set them one through eight respectively with a map of what they are set to on a piece of paper mounted above the coding station.
